Are there any issues or instructions regarding the jurisdiction codes?
Can the claim and response proceed?
Select all that apply. Does the claim, or part of it, appear to be a claim which:
The tribunal has no jurisdiction to consider
Is in a form which cannot sensibly be responded to or otherwise an abuse of process
Has neither an EC number nor claims one of the EC exemptions
States that one of the EC exceptions applies but it might not
Institutes relevant proceedings and the EC number on the claim form does not match the EC number on the Acas certificate
Has a different claimant name on the ET1 to the claimant name on the Acas certificate
Has a different respondent name on the ET1 to the respondent name on the Acas certificate
Is the respondent a government agency or a major employer?
Can the claimant attend a video hearing?

Is there an issue with whether the respondent is a legal entity?
HintText: Check all respondents. If any appear to have an issue with their legal status, select Yes.

Label: Did we receive the ET3 response in time
Does the claim include any of the following?
An allegation of commission of sexual offence
Potentially linked cases in the ECM
Does the claim include any of the following?
A claimant covered by vexatious litigant order
A part of national multiple / covered by Presidential case management order
A request for transfer to another ET region
A sensitive issue which may attract publicity or need early allocation to a specific judge
Any potential conflict involving judge, non-legal member or HMCTS staff member
Another reason for Regional Employment Judge / Vice-President referral
Does the claim include any of the following?
The whole or any part of the claim is out of time
The claim is part of a multiple claim
The claim has a potential issue about employment status
The claim has PID jurisdiction and claimant wants it forwarded to relevant regulator - Box 10.1
The claimant prefers a video hearing
The claim has other relevant factors for judicial referral
